fields.description: During file change in commit view files are not changing after second click. POC provided in attachment.
fields.summary: File change does not work on commit view

fields.description:
I used a previous version of SourceTree (1.7.0 I think) to download and install the update to 1.8.2. After logging in to my Atlassian account and skipping the rest of the setup the application crashed, with the following errors in the log file:

fields.summary: Crash on startup after update

fields.description: When trying to staging a few files at the same time, checking the "Unstaged Files" checkbox, SourceTree does not respond, only when changig tab from "Log/History" to "File Status" and back.
fields.summary: Staging a group of files in Source Tree does not respond, only when changig tab from "Log/History" to "File Status" f.ex and back.

fields.description:
*Observed Behavior:*
After Upgrade to this version our git version 1.7.4 is not supported anymore.
See error dialog after opening SourceTree:
!000012.png!

bq. It's not possible to change our git version to an higher one because of some other dependencies.

*Expected Behavior:*
Source Tree is working with this version.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not work with git version 1.7.4.msysgit.0 anymore

fields.description: Checking file changes when staging files for a commit in v1.8.2 has poor user experience compared to previous versions (old UI) and compared to the Mac version.  Once a file is staged the diff should move to the next unstaged file. The white text box for diffs should take up the full width of the panel, not just the text width.  At times SourceTree loses track of what file is being looked at.  Obviously this was a major change (and for one I do like the new UI), but it is unfortunate that there seem to be a few too many bugs.
fields.summary: File Status behaviour is poor

fields.description:
Bottom right diff view doesn't expand across page. Sometimes hides characters in long lines?!

 !image-2016-02-23-11-00-28-120.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Diff view does not expand to full width

fields.summary: Fatal error while staging file

fields.description:
Just upgraded to 1.8.2.3 to find that SourceTree fails to load any of my repositories with error messages like this:

---------------------------
Error encountered
---------------------------
'git status' failed with code -1: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: The system cannot find the file specified
 (C:\RepostioryPath)
---------------------------
OK   
---------------------------

This renders SourceTree completely unusable for me. Had to go back to 1.7.0.32509 for now and starting to consider other Git client options.
fields.summary: Repository paths can not be found

fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes at startup

fields.description:
*First Bug*
In the file status tab, the preview panel is in blank if you try to see the changes in a file. It can happens with a file staged or unstaged file. To see the preview as always you need to click again in the same file (double click), but if you change the preview between unstaged and staged  files, the bug appears again.

*Second Bug*
If you highlight two unstaged files and press square button to staged it, the result in the staged panel is only one file, to solve this bug you need to stage one file at time
fields.summary: Preview Panel and stage multiples files

fields.description:
http://screencast.com/t/598JWJxo

There is another bug ( SRCTREEWIN-4499 ) created for this bug, but it is marked as resolved, whereas it clearly is not resolved.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes on external Merge result

fields.description: See attached pictures. Files with invalid painting contains Russian characters.
fields.summary: Invalid painting in DiffView for utf-8 files with non-ASCII characters

fields.description:
The application just crashed when double-clicked a file on the list of files included in a previous commit.

I attach the log as requested.
fields.summary: Crash when double-clicking a file in the list of commited files

h4. SourceTree has stopped working

Opening in a debugger gives:

All was working fine until yesterdays upgrade to 1.8.1 today's 1.8.2 update did not solve the issue.

Might also be related to SRCTREEWIN-4382

fields.description: In the commit dialog, the "select all"-checkbox next to the "Unstaged files"-text doesn't work. It initializes a loader in the "Staged files"-list above but doesn't do anything else. If you wait a while and then select a single file to stage, it gives you a succes-dialog (for that single file) after which all the files are staged.
fields.summary: Checkbox for selecting all unstaged files not working

fields.description:
During installation, the dialog box that prompts the user to install a default global ignore file has only one button: "OK". The text of the dialog implies that two options should be available: "Yes" and "No".

!global_dialog.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Incorrect dialog box options during install

fields.description: It will be great if users can change the default prefixes that appear in the git flow initialize dialog, so that if users are working in a team, all users do not have to specifically remember to type in the prefixes every time.
fields.summary: Feature request: Be able to change and set git flow's default prefixes.

fields.description: In Tools > Options > Diff, whatever changes we do to the font size and type does not change the actual diff font at all.
fields.summary: The font configuration for Internal Diff View is not working.

fields.description: Tree structure is the best way to look over sources. If paths are very deep, Flat List view would confuse users.
fields.summary: Tree View is the Best Way to Look Over Sources

fields.description: When I installed 1.8.2 and logged in Atlassian account, it tells that I don't have Mecurial installed and give 3 options to me. I choose that I don't want to use Mecurial, and then it crash.
fields.summary: Crash at first launch after installed 1.8.2

fields.description:
It would be nice that when selecting "Clone / New" and under the "Clone Repository" tab to be able to browse and select a Git bundle file that may be found on the system. The current browse capability only supports the selection of a folder.

Work around to clone from a Git bundle is to explicitly type (or paste in) the full path to the Git bundle file (ex: D:\myProject.bundle).
fields.summary: allow "browsing for repository to clone" to support a git bundle selection

fields.description:
See attached video for a walk-through of the bug, but here's a text description:

We have a smudge/clean filter called "git bin" (https://github.com/seeq12/git-bin) that we use to deal with large files. (git-lfs didn't exist until recently or we probably would have used that.)

As of my upgrade this morning to SourceTree 1.8.2, SourceTree's invocation of git no longer finds the "git bin" filter. Invoking "git bin" works fine from the Windows command line and from Git Bash.

This is being encountered with other developers on our team as well.

I tried to debug it a little bit-- using Process Explorer I confirmed that both SourceTree.exe and any spawned Git.exe processes have the correct _Path_ environment variable. So I don't know what could be going wrong.
fields.summary: Upgrade to SourceTree 1.8.2 breaks git filter support

fields.description:
In previous versions of SourceTree, I've gotten into the habit of clicking spacebar on unstaged files so that I can screen them one at a time before staging them proper.  When I tried to that in this latest version, I noticed that this functionality has been removed which makes me a little sad.  So then I tried tabbing into the checkbox and clicked spacebar and it ended up crashing the app almost immediately, which is a lot more concerning.  Using the mouse to check the checkbox still works fine.

The attached picture shows the unstaged file that I had just spacebar'd and the error that follows.  Also attached is the log file.
fields.summary: Clicking spacebar on an unstaged file crashes the application

fields.description:
I have the "Do not fast-forward when merging, always create commit" option in the git preferences turned on. I was surprised today when finishing a feature, which had only one commit and no other activity on the develop branch since the feature branch was created, that the merge was fast-forwarded on top of the develop branch instead of creating a merge commit as set by my preference.

Git-flow should obey this preference.
fields.summary: Git-flow finish feature merge does not obey fast-forward merge preference

fields.description:
The wrapping on the diff view is disjointed & inconsistent

In editions prior to 1.8.1 the diff view wrapped to the full width of the window. In 1.8.1 and beyond it doesn't, making it look very messy, unprofessional and unreadable.
fields.summary: Diff view wrapping UI

fields.description:
In the list of branches, the current branch is bolded, so that the user knows which branch they're on.

The Log/History tab should also bold or highlight the current branch, so that the user can see where their current branch is in the commit history.
fields.summary: Highlight the current branch in the Log/History view
error to open sourcetree

Related to SRCTREEWIN-4547

fields.description:
Cannot use system git and open a repository

Dialog below:

---------------------------
Error encountered
---------------------------
'git status' failed with code -1: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: The system cannot find the file specified
 (F:\git\platform_api)
---------------------------
OK   
---------------------------

If I switch to embedded git, this problem does not appear.
fields.summary: Cannot open a repository when system git is enabled

fields.description:
SourceTree crashes on startup after update to latest version. See attached log.

*Symptoms*
After completing the update wizard SourceTree starts and loads bookmarks but then crashes.

*Cause*
SourceTree has not correctly initialized its connections to the git/hg installs and is unable to correctly initialize its representations of the repositories.

*Workaround*
Restarting SourceTree should put it in its correct state, able to open repositories.

We are working on a complete fix.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashing on startup

fields.description: As soon as I click on the checkbock to add any unstaged file to the staging area, the program crashes.
fields.summary: Fatal error while staging

fields.description:
File Status Pane
Once you select to do a diff from the pending files, you can no longer do a diff on unstaged files.  The diff continues to show the selected item in the pending files pane, not the selected item in the unstaged files pane.

Also experiencing the following:
Not able to drag the diff pane to make it larger.  The move icon shows but the pane will not resize.  This is annoying because you can't get to the Stage/unstage buttons without scrolling the diff pane.

Many areas of the diff pane are not repainting.  For example, if the diff pane has 3 hunks and the first hunk is the widest, it repaints fine.  However, the 2nd and 3rd hunk only repaint the window to the width of the hunk leaving the far right as the default background color.  In my case, the background of the diff is white but the background window color is gray so I have strange gray boxes on the right for diffs with smaller widths.
fields.summary: Diff does not show properly and UI Broken
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.  at SourceTree.View.ChangeSets.ChangeSetViewManager.GenerateViewModel[T]

fields.description:
repro (100%)

start SourceTree

'ssh-agent' failed with code -1: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object ()
fields.summary: crash in ssh-agent on start

fields.description:
Up until version 1.7.0 there was a way to enable all developers of a company to work with SourceTree based on a corporate license:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/SourceTree+License+For+Corporate+Usage

From version 1.8 starting this possibility has been dropped and every developer has to register a atlassian account - and log in with that - in order to be able to use SourceTree.
This is even mandatory when managing repositories totaly unrelated to any atlassian product (local repos, repos from other services than bitbucket).

This kind of philosophy may be a nice tracking feature for Atlassian, but it's not acceptable for a companywide use.
I will not force every single developer to create a atlassian account and i m sure other companies won't do that too. 

I highly recommend to take a step back or you will lose a large userbase (or it just sticks to very old versions - 1.6 series was the last real stable!).
fields.summary: Reenable corporate licenses

fields.description:
After switching branches SourceTree 1.8.1 automatically switches the view to the working copy of this branch. Earlier versions did not change the view (e.g. kept branches view active)

While this might be desirable in some workflows it's a disturbance in others and it's definitely unexpected (i.e. the user never chose to switch the view to working copy)
Therefore automatically switching views should not be done.
fields.summary: Do not switch to working copy after switching branches

fields.description:
Guys, we updated SourceTree to the latest version, and now it deletes local projects folders by itself from time to time.

Are you kidding?!
fields.summary: SourceTree deleted local folders

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create several changed files
# Stage 1 of them
# Click that file in the 'Staged Files' pane - a preview appears to the right
# Click one of the files in the 'Unstaged Files' pane

Expected: I should see the unstaged file that I clicked on, in the right-hand pane, and nothing else.
Actual: The staged file I last clicked on remains in the right-hand pane - and the unstaged file I just clicked on appears at the bottom, either just as the file name (if modified) or in full (if a new file)
fields.summary: Viewing a staged file in the preview area stops unstaged files from showing there
Files can be truncated when shown in change preview area

fields.description: When selecting an item in the working copy (that is not yet added or modified) I can't select the ignore option.
fields.summary: Can't ignore files

fields.description: Although I imagine this is by design, it seems impossible to deselect a line if one is inadvertently selected so if you want to then stage hunk, it is almost impossible. It would be much better to have stage hunk still visible when a line is selected to override the selection and stage the hunk
fields.summary: Stage hunk button disappears when stage lines button is visible

fields.description:
It would be better if the stage hunk and discard hunk buttons on the diff window didn't scroll with the horizontal scroll bars.

When considering a change that happens to be very short, but a line further down is very long, it can get confusing
fields.summary: Stage hunk and discard hunk aren't visible if there are horizontal scroll bars

fields.description:
Staging the missing files SourceTree never stops loading. They are deleted and should be marked as such. No crash involved. Individually staging the missing files produces the following error:

{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false rm -q -f -- "My File.meta"
fatal: pathspec 'My File.meta' did not match any files
{noformat}


If I stage the file through the Terminal "_git rm "Path\To\My\File\My File.meta"_" it works.
It seems that the staging through the SourceTree UI uses the wrong path.
fields.summary: Unable to stage missing files in "File Status"

fields.description:
UI freezes after adding a new file to a folder.

To narrow down the issue, I changed the contents of the file being added, it still freezes the UI. I then changed the name of the file by one character, keeping the same contents and it worked fine.  After committing the file, I renamed it to the original name I wanted, and it worked fine.

While the app was frozen, I turned on DEBUG logging to see what was going on and the following line was being logged continuously.

fields.description:
1. Looking at the Uncommitted changes on a git repository
2. Select an unstaged file then the diff window correctly shows the diff for the selected file
3. Stage that file - diff clears and the file moves from the unstaged to staged area
4. Select an unstaged file then the diff window correctly shows the diff for the selected file
5. Select the staged file then the diff window correctly shows the diff for the selected file
6. Select an unstaged file and the diff window incorrectly continues to show the staged file diff.
7. Unstage the staged file and everything is back to where we started
fields.summary: After viewing the diff on a staged file, selecting an unstaged file leaves the last diff visible instead of showing the diff for the selected file

fields.summary: "Stage hunk" is not visible for a long lines in hunk

fields.description: Updating a submodule does not show the new submodule commithash.
fields.summary: Submodule commit does not show new commit-hash

fields.description:
Rename a bitbake receipe
from enigma2-plugin-extensions-dbackup.bb
to enigma2-plugin-extensions-dbackup.bb-deactivated

Sourcetree now does not properly show it as renamed/moved.
It keeps the deleted files and they are not addable to the commit.
fields.summary: Renamed files are not properly commitable

fields.description: New commit-hash is missing on updating a submodule.
fields.summary: Submodule commit does not show new commit-hash

fields.description: Double clik on file names in commit crashes SourceTree. Repository is Mercurial, handled by Tortoise64 - I'm trying to migrate my workflows to SourceTree.
fields.summary: Crash after double click on files names in all commits

fields.description:
Since I'have updated to version 1.8.1.0 every time I try to do anything the program gets frozen and then crashes or I have to kill it.

it is impossible to open the history view of a repository that is already added.
When the conflicts in a file are resolved with an external tool (KDiff3) the tool crashes
And so on...
fields.summary: Since the last update the whole program is broken, crashes all the time

fields.description:
When on any other tab (e.g The History tab), the application will force switch you back to the File Status tab every minute making browsing the history pretty much impossible. (Looks like whenever it polls for changes).

This is intermittent and closing down the application and reopening makes it go away for a while.
fields.summary: App constantly switches back to File Status tab on its own

fields.description:
The latest version keeps switching to "File Status" view no matter what other view you select.
It is practically impossible to work on any of the other views because as soon as you switch to something else, it goes back to "File Status" on it's own.
fields.summary: Keeps switching to "File Status" view on refresh.
Cannot add all unstaged files at the same time using the checkbox at top

fields.description:
When choosing SSH instead of HTTPS for the protocol for a bitbucket account, after clicking OK, the account is still on HTTPS - it never accepts the change.

Happens on Windows 1.8.1.0 and Mac 2.2
fields.summary: SSH protocol for bitbucket cloud account never saves
No "Flow" button on the toolbar

fields.description:
I'm attaching two screen shots. In the old version of 1.7, it had a Git-Flow, but it's not present in 1.8?? 

Why was that removed? I liked having that feature!
fields.summary: No Git-Flow on 1.8.X????

fields.description:
This has been closed as a duplicarte of fixed issue, but the issue is clearly still there.

Version 1.8.1.0

clicking on "Browse to the location of Mercurial on your system" in Options\Mercurial tab does not trigger any browse dialogue. Using check again will not find Mercucial hence I cannot use mercurial (I do not want to use embbeded version) with source tree.

Mercurial is installed on via via TortoiseHg in folder C:\Program Files\Mercurial ...
fields.summary: Adding Mercurial support broken - still

fields.summary: Crash in check file staging

fields.description:
When a file is deleted the latest version of Source Tree can't stage the delete file so I can't commit the file deletion.

In my case a file has been renamed in Windows Explorer e.g. _file_ver_0129.c has become _file_ver_0130.c_ Source Tree sees this as one file being added and one flle being deleted - I have added and committed the new file to the repository, but when I attempt to stage/commit the deleted file I get the error:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false rm -q -f -- file_ver_0129.c
fatal: pathspec 'file_ver_0129' did not match any files

Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Cannot stage files that've been delted

fields.description: Rebasing with SourceTree on Windows is a pain. It is slow and often it fails all together. I didn't think much of it until I did the same operations with SourceTree on my Mac. It's at least 10 times faster (really) and it never fails.
fields.summary: Rebase performance is terrible

fields.description: Why does SourceTree keep changing to the File Status tab? I do a lot of my work in Log/History and since the last update it is changing back to File Status all the time. It is really annoying. Please make it stop.
fields.summary: Don't change to file status tab all the time

fields.description:
# Switch to Loh/History tab
# Click Fetch
# Click close in dialog window
# Tab has been change to File Status
fields.summary: SourceTree change tab after fetch

fields.description:
When I have an unstaged (or staged) file, the context menu opened by clicking on the ... icon on the right of the file panel doesn't give me the option to discard the file changes. Instead, the option 'Stage File' is shown twice (neither of them works, though). 
Also, when I click the Discard icon in the top menu and try to select a file under 'Discard File Changes', nothing happens.
fields.summary: Can't discard changes on single file

fields.description: Sourcetree crashes after it has been started. See log attached.
fields.summary: Crash on application start

fields.description:
Almost every update brings developer new "unwanted improvements" ;) (bugs)
Ones can life with them others gets angry (probably most of them)

Please give us possibility to make rollback of update easy.
fields.summary: Revert update

fields.description: Tried to checkin changes.  One change, which was to delete a file.  Tried to start typing in the checkin message and it crashed..  Now I cannot start it again without it crashing.
fields.summary: Tried to commit changes

fields.description:
I just upgraded to the new V1.8.1.0 windows version, on Windows 10.
Now almost everytime I try to stage changes with roughly more than 10-15 files,  ready to be committed, sourceTree hangs while trying to stage the files, sometimes it eventually completes and stages correctly, other times it crashes the app.

The only work around I have found it to Stage files via the command line "git add .", then  refresh SourceTree, via F5.
fields.summary: SourceTree hangs regularly when staging files

fields.description: If you have a merge conflict that you want to resolve with an external merge tool (in my case Araxis merge) after you save the resolve and close Araxis merge Source Tree now crashes.  On earlier versions this worked fine.
fields.summary: Resolving a 3-way merge conflict with an external editor (Araxis merge) now results in a crash.  In previous versions it was fine.
